weaponProfile.title: Longinus
weaponProfile.specialAbility: A fully charged shot has 100% Armor Penetration and deals bonus damage based on the distance to the target. It cannot be silenced.

manufacturingIntel.creator: Lin Junjie (Kang Tao Ballistics Division)
manufacturingIntel.creatorReputation: Lin Junjie is a 'brute-force' theorist, a direct rival to the elegant, stealth-focused engineers at Arasaka. He believes that no problem exists that cannot be solved with a sufficiently large application of kinetic energy. His designs are infamous for their massive power consumption, deafening sound profiles, and unparalleled destructive capability.
manufacturingIntel.developmentHistory: The Longinus was Kang Tao's answer to the heavily armored 'Behemoth'-class cyborgs deployed by Militech during the Fourth Corporate War. The primary innovation is the 'Magnetic Final Stage Acceleration' (MFSA) system. The molten tungsten spike is fired conventionally, but a series of magnetic coils along the barrel accelerate it further *after* it has already left, ensuring maximum velocity at extreme ranges. The project was deemed too power-intensive and slow for standard infantry, relegating it to a highly specialized, anti-materiel role. Only a handful of prototypes were ever field-tested.

strengths: Unrivaled single-shot damage, capable of one-shotting most targets.
A fully charged shot ignores all armor, making it the ultimate tank-killer.
Exceptional performance at extreme ranges, with damage increasing over distance.
Devastating against vehicles, mechs, and heavily armored cyborgs.
weaknesses: Cannot be silenced, making it a 'one shot, one alert' weapon.
Extremely slow rate of fire and a lengthy reload leave the user vulnerable.
The charge time makes hitting fast-moving targets incredibly difficult.
Unique ammunition is nearly impossible to find on the open market.
tacticalAssessment.recommendedRoles: Anti-Materiel Sniper, Designated Marksman, Heavy Asset Neutralizer.
tacticalAssessment.masteryArchetype: A 'Patient Hunter' build. A solo with a high Cool attribute who finds a perch and waits for the perfect shot. They don't engage in firefights; they end them before they begin. Cyberware that enhances optical zoom, stability, and battlefield awareness is essential to unlock its true, city-block-spanning potential.

acquisitionIntel.marketAvailability: Effectively zero. The Longinus is a state secret. It cannot be bought. It can only be 'acquired' as the ultimate reward from a legendary fixer for an impossible job, or pried from the hands of a Kang Tao black ops commander.
acquisitionIntel.rumoredLocation: Intel suggests a Kang Tao convoy transporting a Longinus prototype was ambushed by Wraiths in the eastern Badlands. The Wraiths, lacking the skill to use it, are rumored to be keeping the weapon as a trophy in their main fortress, the 'Sun-Scorched Overlook,' under the personal guard of their leader.

fieldTestimonials.context: Neutralizing a Militech Behemoth cyborg during a convoy escort.
fieldTestimonials.feedback: 'Saw the Behemoth crest the ridge and thought we were done for. One charged shot from the Longinus, right through the cockpit. It didn't just stop it; it turned the whole damn chassis into a molten slag heap. This thing doesn't just kill, it erases.'

fieldTestimonials.context: Clearing a Maelstrom den in a tight corridor.
fieldTestimonials.feedback: 'Tried to use it indoors. BIG mistake. By the time I'd charged one shot, three psychos were already chewing on my face. This thing is like trying to swat a fly with a sledgehammer. It's useless if your target is anywhere in the same zip code as you. Sold it for a shotgun.'

fieldTestimonials.context: Corporate assassination from a rooftop in City Center.
fieldTestimonials.feedback: 'The engineering is insane. The power draw dims the lights in your apartment. The shot sounds like a thunderclap. It's not a rifle; it's a controlled catastrophe. It does one thing, and one thing only, perfectly. Just make sure you're a long, long way away when you pull the trigger.'
